alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:27PM MDT until April 17 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Between 7 and 8 feet multiple locations along highway 4 between San Ysidro and Jemez Springs will see water crossing the road at mile markers 1, 2 and 33. The wastewater treatment plant 1 mile downstream of Jemez Springs will be impacted. At 8.0 feet, Significant overbank flows are occurring from above Jemez Springs down through the Jemez Pueblo. Further rises will result in bridges becoming unsafe to cross in and around Jemez Springs. At 10.0 feet, Widespread overbank flooding is occurring. Bridges in and around Jemez Springs are either impassable or unsafe to cross due to the high water and debris caught up in the fast flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value ranging between 8.5 and 10 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 05/13/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning around 900 AM MDT.
